## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've got a question about basket currencies in Verus. What are some special properties of basket currencies, and how can they be customized using parameters like "relaunchcarveout", "prelaunchdiscount", and "weights"?

**AI Assistant:**
Basket currencies in Verus are really powerful tools, and they have some unique properties that can be customized to fit specific use cases.

In Verus, basket currencies are a type of currency that allows users to preconvert other currencies into its reserves in exchange for a distribution of the new currency. Basket currencies have some unique properties that can be customized using specific parameters.

One of these properties is the "relaunchcarveout" parameter, which allows a percentage of the reserves to be taken out and moved to the root ID when the currency is launched. This lowers the reserve ratio by the specified percentage.

Another property is the "prelaunchdiscount" parameter, which allows creators to offer a discount to users who preconvert their currencies during the preconversion time frame. When the currency is launched, the conversion price increases by the discounted percentage, and the reserve ratio is lowered by the same percentage.

Lastly, the "weights" parameter allows creators to customize the respective weights of the reserves in a basket currency. The total of all weights must equal 1, and each weight must be at least 0.1, since there can't be more than 10 reserve currencies in a basket currency.

Here's an example of how these parameters can be used to create a customized basket currency:

```json
definecurrency '{
 "name":"MyBusiness", 
 "options":33, 
 "currencies":["vrsctest","BusinessBrand","DiscountBrand"], 
 "initialsupply":100, 
 "weights":[0.5,0.25,0.25],
 "prelaunchdiscount":0.5,
 "relaunchcarveout":0.1
}'
```

In this example, the basket currency "MyBusiness" has three reserve currencies: VRSCTEST, BusinessBrand, and DiscountBrand. The weights of these reserves are 0.5, 0.25, and 0.25, respectively. The currency also has a prelaunch discount of 50%, which means that users who preconvert their currencies will get a 50% discount. When the currency is launched, the conversion price will increase by 50%, and the reserve ratio will be lowered by 50%. Finally, 10% of the reserves will be taken out and moved to the root ID when the currency is launched, lowering the reserve ratio by 10%.

One of these properties is the "relaunchcarveout" parameter, which allows a percentage of the reserves to be taken out and moved to the root ID when the currency is launched. This lowers the reserve ratio by the specified percentage.

“prelaunchdiscount”
Only works with basket currencies (options:33). Use this to give people a discount during the preconversion time frame. After the preconversion time frame and the currency is launched, the conversion price will be higher, depending on what percentage the discount was.
When using this parameter, after the currency is launched, the reserve ratio will be lowered by the discounted percentage.
Example currency:
definecurrency '{
 "name":"DiscountBrand", 
 "options":33, 
 "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "initialsupply":100, 
 "prelaunchdiscount":0.5
}'
🔍 This is a basket currency called DiscountBrand. People can preconvert VRSCTEST into its reserves in return for 100 DiscountBrand distributed among them.
